metadata.Title: CVE-2017-14461 on Ubuntu 16.04 ESM (xenial) - medium.
metadata.Description:
A specially crafted email delivered over SMTP and passed on to Dovecot by MTA can trigger an out of bounds read resulting in potential sensitive information disclosure and denial of service. In order to trigger this vulnerability, an attacker needs to send a specially crafted email message to the server.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2017-14461` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

dovecot-core - 1:2.2.22-1ubuntu2.7
dovecot-gssapi - 1:2.2.22-1ubuntu2.7
dovecot-imapd - 1:2.2.22-1ubuntu2.7
dovecot-ldap - 1:2.2.22-1ubuntu2.7
dovecot-lmtpd - 1:2.2.22-1ubuntu2.7
dovecot-lucene - 1:2.2.22-1ubuntu2.7
dovecot-managesieved - 1:2.2.22-1ubuntu2.7
dovecot-mysql - 1:2.2.22-1ubuntu2.7
dovecot-pgsql - 1:2.2.22-1ubuntu2.7
dovecot-pop3d - 1:2.2.22-1ubuntu2.7
dovecot-sieve - 1:2.2.22-1ubuntu2.7
dovecot-solr - 1:2.2.22-1ubuntu2.7
dovecot-sqlite - 1:2.2.22-1ubuntu2.7
mail-stack-delivery - 1:2.2.22-1ubuntu2.7
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: dovecot package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1:2.2.22-1ubuntu2.7').
